textBeforeTable: A. General Education Courses (16 SHC) Course Requirements for Accounting Degree Program Sites: Lee Campus - Day Program, Selected Evening; Distance Education Career Pathway Option: Associate in Applied Science Degree in Accounting Program Length: 4 semesters Academic Standards: See General Academic Standards. Entrance Standards: See General Admission Standards. Graduates should qualify for entry-level accounting positions in many types of organizations including accounting firms, small businesses, manufacturing firms, banks, hospitals, school systems, and governmental agencies. With work experience and additional education, an individual may advance in the accounting profession. In addition to coursework in accounting principles, theories, and practice, students will study business law, finance, management, and economics. Related skills are developed through the study of Communication, computer applications, financial analysis, critical thinking skills, and ethics. The Accounting curriculum is designed to provide students with the knowledge and the skills necessary for employment and growth in the accounting profession. Using the "language of business," accountants assemble and analyze, process, and communicate essential information about financial operations. Accounting Credential: Associate in Applied Science Degree in Accounting A25100 Business Technologies College Catalog 2008-2010 Table of Contents Money for College College Services Distance Education Continuing Education
